Other than their majesty, intelligence and right to survival, Elephants are Africa’s gardeners and landscape engineers, planting seeds and creating critical habitat wherever they roam.
Other than their majesty, intelligence and right to survival, Elephants are Africa’s gardeners and landscape engineers, planting seeds and creating critical habitat wherever they roam.

settings.title: During 2011 alone, roughly one of every twelve African elephants was killed by a poacher.

settings.title: Our Initiatives save critically endangered wildlife from habitat loss & poaching.

settings.editor: Our mission is to secure a future for elephants and to sustain the beauty and ecological integrity of the places they live; to promote man’s delight in their intelligence and the diversity of their world, and to develop a tolerant relationship between the two species.
